data.title: Nation celebrates Queen Suthida's birthday
data.meta_description: Thailand's most updated English news website, thai news, thailand news, Bangkok thailand, aec,newspaper english, breaking news : The Nation
data.text:
Thailand celebrates the royal birthday of Her Majesty Queen Suthida Bajrasudhabimalalakshana on Wednesday (June 3), which is a national holiday.

Her Majesty was granted the royal title of Queen by His Majesty the King on May 1, 2019. Later, on May 4, 2019, a ceremony was held for the royal investiture as HM the Queen.

Early life

The Queen was born on June 3, 1978, at Ban Phru subdistrict, Hat Yai district in Songkhla province in a Chinese-Thai family. Then known as Suthida Tidjai, she attended high school at Hatyai Witthayalai Somboon Kulkanya school. After that, she studied the Bachelor of Communication Arts programme at the Faculty of Communication Arts at Assumption University and graduated in 2000.

After graduation, she became a flight attendant on JAL Airline from 2000 to 2003 and was a flight attendant in Thai Airways from 2003 to 2008, living a normal life.

Later, she entered the military service in the Command Unit, offering security to the King. She rose to the position of Deputy Commander-in-Chief of the Royal Guard Unit (Special General) and received royal grace to be a royal bodyguard of the Royal Family and many royals.

On May 1, 2019, she got married to HM King Maha Vajiralongkorn at Amporn Amphorn Royal Palace, and became Queen Sutida. Later, at the HM Royal Investiture ceremony she became HM Queen Suthida Bajrasudhabimalalakshana.

The 7th Queen of Chakri Dynasty

Queen Sutida is the seventh Queen of the Chakri Dynasty. In chronological order, they are:

▪︎ Queen Somdet Phra Amarindra, in the reign of King Rama I

▪︎ Queen Somdet Phra Sri Suriyendra Boromarajini, in the reign of King Rama II

▪︎ Queen Somdet Phra Debsirindra Boromarajini, in the reign of King Rama IV

▪︎ Queen Somdet Phra Nangchao Indrasakdi Sachi Phra Boromarajini in the reign of King Rama VI

▪︎ Queen Somdet Phra Nangchao Rambai Barni Phra Boromarajini in the reign of King Rama VII

▪︎ Queen Somdet Phra Nangchao Sirikit Phra Boromarajininat in the reign of King Rama IX

▪︎ Her Majesty Queen Suthida Bajarasudha Bimollaksana, in the reign of King Rama X
